org.mini2Dx.core.data

Interface Data

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AndroidData, DesktopData, IOSData

    public interface Data
    Common interface for reading/writing game data, e.g. game saves, preferences, etc. The location to save data in is automatically determined by the game identifier and the current platform. All files/directories specified by the developer will be automatically placed inside the pre-determined data location. Note: Objects must use Field annotations to be serialized/deserialized properly

    • Method Detail

      • readXml

        <T> T readXml(java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
              java.lang.String... filepath)
       throws java.lang.Exception
        Converts XML from a file into an object. Note the object must use the mini2Dx data annotations.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The object type to convert the XML into
        filepath - The path to the XML file. This will be resolved as a path within the game data location.
        Returns:
        The resulting object
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown if the XML is invalid, the file does not exist or the game data location cannot be accessed.

      • writeXml

        <T> void writeXml(T object,
                  java.lang.String... filepath)
           throws java.lang.Exception
        Writes an object as XML to a file. Note the object must use the mini2Dx data annotations.
        Parameters:
        object - The object to be written to the file
        filepath - The path to the XML file. This will be resolved as a path within the game data location.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown if the game data location cannot be accessed or the data cannot be written to the file.

      • readJson

        <T> T readJson(java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
               java.lang.String... filepath)
        throws java.lang.Exception
        Converts JSON from a file into an object. Note the object must use the mini2Dx data annotations.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The object type to convert the JSON into
        filepath - The path to the JSON file. This will be resolved as a path within the game data location.
        Returns:
        The resulting object
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown if the XML is invalid, the file does not exist or the game data location cannot be accessed.

                   java.lang.String... filepath)

        Writes an object as JSON to a file. Note the object must use the mini2Dx data annotations.
        Parameters:
        object - The object to be written to the file
        filepath - The path to the JSON file. This will be resolved as a path within the game data location.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown if the game data location cannot be accessed or the data cannot be written to the file.

      • hasFile

        boolean hasFile(java.lang.String... filepath)
         throws java.lang.Exception
        Checks if the file exists in the game data location
        Parameters:
        filepath - The path to the file within the game data location
        Returns:
        True if the file exists
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown if the game data location cannot be accessed

        Throws:

      • wipe

        void wipe()
   throws java.lang.Exception
        Wipes all data within the game data location
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown if the game data location cannot be accessed or the data could not be wiped
